current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and
		  Emergency Assistance Act to provide for wildfire mitigation grants, and for
		  other purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

			 Areas at Risk of Emergency Wildfires Act of 2013

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , acting through the

, shall establish a pilot program to
				make grants to States for wildfire mitigation and preparedness.

text.#text: The

header.#text:
Establishment
				of wildfire mitigation and preparedness grant program

text.#text: A grant under this section may be used by a State—

to invest in
				personnel and organizations to improve wildfire preparedness;

to invest in
				vehicles and other equipment to improve wildfire preparedness;

at the discretion
				of the Governor of a State, for any other wildfire mitigation and preparedness
				activities on Federal, State, or private land in the State, unless otherwise
				prohibited by law.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
grant ratio for such State is equal to or greater than 150 percent of the State
				population ratio.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:420

text.#text:
The Governor of a State may award funds received under
				this section, to be used solely for the purposes set forth under

any county or

any other entity
				that is explicitly referenced in and central to, in the determination of the
				Governor, the design of a community wildfire protection plan or a local
				mitigation plan.

				under this section, the

give preference

a State with a

				as determined by the

a State that
				provides matching non-Federal funds, including funds from nongovernmental
				entities, equal to not less than 100 percent of the amount of Federal funds
				made available under this section; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

a State that
				previously received a grant under this section and efficiently and effectively

consider
				environmental conditions in a State, including environmental changes,
				deteriorating forest health, and overall wildfire risk.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

may reasonably require.

text.#text:
To request a grant under this section, a State shall
				submit an application to the

text.#text:
In

the State has a

the State shall

a county or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report, which shall be made publicly

text.#text:
Not
				later than 1 year after the date of receipt of a grant under this section, a
				State shall submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:203/ss:i

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall use not less than $20,000,000 and not more than $30,000,000
				from unobligated amounts in the National Predisaster Mitigation Fund for each
				of fiscal years 2014 through 2019 in carrying out this section.

text.#text:
Subject to the availability of funds in the
				National Predisaster Mitigation Fund established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in any given fiscal
				year.

text.#text:
Nothing in this section shall be construed to
				increase the amount of appropriations authorized for the
